ArabicTitle: مِنْ سِفْرِ أَيُّوبَ الْصِدِّيق بَرَكَتْهُ الْمُقَدَّسَةُ فَلْتَكُنْ مَعَنَا. آمين . ( ١٥ : ١ - ٣٥ )

Hymn.Arabic: فَأَجَابَ أَلِيفَارُ التَّيْمَانِيُّ وَقَالَ:
Hymn.English: 15:1 Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said:

Hymn.Arabic: أَلَعَلَّ الْحَكِيمَ يُجِيبُ عَنْ عِلْمٍ بَاطِلٍ ، وَيَمْلأُ جَوْفَهُ رِيحًا شَرْقِيَّةً ،
Hymn.English: 2 Should a wise man answer with empty knowledge, And fill himself with the east wind?

Hymn.Arabic: فَيَحْتَجَّ بِكَلَامٍ لَا يُفيدُ ، وَبِأَقْوَالٍ لَا مَعْنَى لَهَا ؟
Hymn.English: 3 Should he reason with unprofitable talk, Or by speeches with which he can do no good?

Hymn.Arabic: بَلْ أَنْتَ تَهْدِمُ التَّقْوَى ، وَتَنْقُضُ عِبَادَةَ اللَّهِ .
Hymn.English: 4 Yes, you cast off fear, And restrain prayer before God.

Hymn.Arabic: وَفَمُكَ يَبُوحُ بِإِثْمِكَ ، وَأَنْتَ تُؤْثِرُ لِسَانَ الْمَاكِرِينَ
Hymn.English: 5 For your iniquity teaches your mouth, And you choose the tongue of the crafty.

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّ فَمَكَ هُوَ يَسْتَذْنِبُكَ ، لَا أَنَا ، وَشَفَتَيْكَ تَشْهَدَانِ عَلَيْكَ.
Hymn.English: 6 Your own mouth condemns you, and not I; Yes, your own lips testify against you.

Hymn.Arabic: أَلَعَلَّكَ وُلِدْتَ أَوَّلَ الْبَشَرِ ، أَمْ أُبْدِعْتَ قَبْلَ التِّلَالِ ؟
Hymn.English: 7 Are you the first man who was born? Or were you made before the hills?

Hymn.Arabic: أَلَعَلَّكَ سَمِعْتَ أَسْرَارَ اللَّهِ ، أَمْ حُزْتَ الْحِكْمَةَ لِنَفْسِكَ ؟
Hymn.English: 8 Have you heard the counsel of God? Do you limit wisdom to yourself?

Hymn.Arabic: مَا الَّذِي تَعْلَمُهُ أَنْتَ وَلَا نَعْلَمُهُ نَحْنُ ، أَمْ مَاذَا اسْتَبَانَ لَكَ وَخَفِيَ عَلَيْنَا ؟
Hymn.English: 9 What do you know that we do not know? What do you understand that is not in us?

Hymn.Arabic: فَرُبَّ أَشْيَبَ عِنْدَنَا وَشَيْخ ، أَكْبَرُ سِنًّا مِنْ أَبِيكَ.
Hymn.English: 10 Both the gray-haired and the aged are among us, Much older than your father.

Hymn.Arabic: أَيَسِيرٌ لَدَيْكَ تَعْزِيَاتُ اللَّهِ ، وَمُلَايَنَتُهُ لَكَ بِالْكَلَامِ ؟
Hymn.English: 11 Are the consolations of God too small for you, And the word spoken gently with you?

Hymn.Arabic: عَلَامَ يَسْتَهْوِيكَ قَلْبُكَ ؟ وَلِمَاذَا تَخْتَلِجُ عَيْنَاكَ
Hymn.English: 12 Why does your heart carry you away, And what do your eyes wink at,

Hymn.Arabic: حَتَّى يَهِيجَ عَلَى اللَّهِ رُوحُكَ ، وَيَنْفُثُ فَمُكَ أَقْوَالًا ؟
Hymn.English: 13 That you turn your spirit against God, And let such words go out of your mouth?

Hymn.Arabic: مَنْ هُوَ الْإِنْسَانُ حَتَّى يَزْكُوَ، وَمَوْلُودُ الْمَرْأَةِ حَتَّى يَتَبَرَّرُ ؟
Hymn.English: 14 What is man, that he could be pure? And he who is born of a woman, that he could be righteous?

Hymn.Arabic: هَا إِنَّ قِدِيسِيهِ لَا يَأْتَمِنُهُمْ ، وَالسَّمَاوَاتِ غَيْرُ زَكِيَّةٍ فِي عَيْنَيْهِ ،
Hymn.English: 15 If God puts no trust in His saints, And the heavens are not pure in His sight,

Hymn.Arabic: فَبِالْحَرِيِّ الرِّجْسُ الْفَاسِدُ الْإِنْسَانُ الَّذِي يَشْرَبُ الْإِثْمَ كَالْمَاءِ!
Hymn.English: 16 How much less man, who is abominable and filthy, Who drinks iniquity like water!

Hymn.Arabic: إِنِّي أُبَيِّنُ لَكَ فَاسْمَعْ لِي ، وَبِمَا رَأَيْتُ أُحَدِثُكَ ،
Hymn.English: 17 I will tell you, hear me; What I have seen I will declare,

Hymn.Arabic: وَبِمَا أَخْبَرَ بِهِ الْحُكَمَاءُ عَنْ آبَائِهِمْ وَلَمْ يَكْتُمُوهُ
Hymn.English: 18 What wise men have told, Not hiding anything received from their fathers,

Hymn.Arabic: الَّذِينَ لَهُمْ وَحْدَهُمْ أُعْطِيَتِ الْأَرْضُ ، وَلَمْ يَدْخُلُ بَيْنَهُمْ غَرِيبٌ
Hymn.English: 19 To whom alone the land was given, And no alien passed among them:

Hymn.Arabic: الْمُنَافِقُ يَتَمَلْمَلُ كُلَّ الْأَيَّامِ ، وَسِنُونَ مَعْدُودَةً إِدُّخِرَتْ لِلْجَائِرِ،
Hymn.English: 20 The wicked man writhes with pain all his days, And the number of years is hidden from the oppressor.

Hymn.Arabic: صَوْتُ الْأَهْوَالِ فِي مِسْمَعَيْهِ. وَفِي سَاعَةِ السَّلَامِ يُفَاجِئُهُ الْمُخَرِّبُ.
Hymn.English: 21 Dreadful sounds are in his ears; In prosperity the destroyer comes upon him.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا يَأْمَنْ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ مِنَ الظُّلْمَةِ ، وَعَيْنُهُ تَرْقُبُ السَّيْفَ
Hymn.English: 22 He does not believe that he will return from darkness, For a sword is waiting for him.

Hymn.Arabic: يَهِيمُ فِي طَلَبِ خُبْزِهِ وَهُوَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّ يَوْمَ الظَّلَامِ إِلَى جَانِبِهِ.
Hymn.English: 23 He wanders about for bread, saying, `Where is it?' He knows that a day of darkness is ready at his hand.

Hymn.Arabic: يَفْجَأَهُ الضُّرُّ وَالضِيقُ ، وَيَتَجَبَّرَانِ عَلَيْهِ كَمَلِكٍ مُسْتَعِدٌ لِلْوَغَى.
Hymn.English: 24 Trouble and anguish make him afraid; They overpower him, like a king ready for battle.

Hymn.Arabic: لِأَنَّهُ مَدَّ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَدَهُ ، وَعَلَى الْقَدِيرِ تَجَبَّرَ ،
Hymn.English: 25 For he stretches out his hand against God, And acts defiantly against the Almighty,

Hymn.Arabic: وَأَغَارَ عَلَيْهِ ، بِعُنُقِقٍ مُتَصَلِبَةٍ تَحْتَ أَوْقَافِ مِجَنِّةِ الْغَلِيظِ.
Hymn.English: 26 Running stubbornly against Him With his strong, embossed shield.

Hymn.Arabic: وَقَدْ كَسَى السَّمْنُ وَجْهَهُ ، وَغَشَى الشَّحْمُ كُلْيَتَيْهِ ،
Hymn.English: 27 Though he has covered his face with his fatness, And made his waist heavy with fat,

Hymn.Arabic: فَاسْتَوْطَنَ مُدُنَّا خَرِبَةً ، بُيُوتًا غَيْرَ مَسْكُونَةٍ , عَنْ قَلِيلٍ سَتَكُونُ رُجَمًا
Hymn.English: 28 He dwells in desolate cities, In houses which no one inhabits, Which are destined to become ruins.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا يُفْلِحُ ، وَلَا يَثْبُتُ يَسَارُهُ ، وَلَا تَنتَشِرُ لَهُ فِي الْأَرْضِ قِنْيَةٌ.
Hymn.English: 29 He will not be rich, Nor will his wealth continue, Nor will his possessions overspread the earth.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا تَبْرَحُهُ الظُّلْمَةُ ، وَاللَّهِيبُ يُذْوِي أَغْصَانَهُ ، وَبِنَفْخَةِ فَمِ اللَّهِ يَزُولُ ،
Hymn.English: 30 He will not depart from darkness; The flame will dry out his branches, And by the breath of His mouth he will go away.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا يَعْتَمِدَنَّ عَلَى الزُّورِ فَإِنَّهُ يُغْوَى وَيَكُونُ الزُّورُ جَزَاءَهُ.
Hymn.English: 31 Let him not trust in futile things, deceiving himself, For futility will be his reward.

Hymn.Arabic: يَسْتَوْفِيهِ قَبْلَ يَوْمِهِ ، وَسَعَفُهُ لَا يَخْضَرُّ.
Hymn.English: 32 It will be accomplished before his time, And his branch will not be green.

Hymn.Arabic: يُسَاقِطُ كَالْجَفْنِ حِصْرِمَهُ ، وَيَنْفُضُ كَالزَّيْتُونِ زَهْرَهُ
Hymn.English: 33 He will shake off his unripe grape like a vine, And cast off his blossom like an olive tree.

Hymn.Arabic: لِأَنَّ جَمَاعَةَ الْمُنَافِقِيْنَ عَقِيمَةٌ ، وَأَخْبِيَةُ الرَّشْوَةِ تأكلها النَّارُ
Hymn.English: 34 For the company of hypocrites will be barren, And fire will consume the tents of bribery.

Hymn.Arabic: حَبلَ بالضَّرَرِ وَوَلَدَ الإِثْمَ ، وَأَحْشَاوَهُ أَنْشَأَتِ الْكَيْدَ.
Hymn.English: 35 They conceive trouble and bring forth futility; Their womb prepares deceit.
